prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3333, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. Create a new face (face_1) and draw a rectangle by adding the following lines: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5833] - line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5833], End Point [0.0, 0.5833] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5833], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and complete the sketch. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with the following parameters: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.3333 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - sketch_scale: 0.75 The result is a three-dimensional rectangular prism, which will serve as the base for the final CAD model. Part 2: Geometric Shape with Rectangular and Triangular Facets Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a combination of rectangular and triangular facets. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2345, 0.0, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. Create a new face (face_1) and draw a rectangle by adding the following lines: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.5833], End Point [0.341, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.341, 0.0], End Point [0.5155, 0.0] - line_3: Start Point [0.5155, 0.0], End Point [0.5155, 0.5833] - line_4: Start Point [0.5155, 0.5833], End Point [0.0, 0.5833] Close the loop and complete the sketch. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.5833. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with the following parameters: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.1667 - sketch_scale: 0.5833 Perform a cut operation on the base part using the current part as the cut feature. The result is the final CAD model, which consists of a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cutout forming a geometric shape with rectangular and triangular facets. The dimensions of the model are defined by the input JSON.</description>
